question: What is the theme of the ‘World Heritage Day 2020’, celebrated on April 18?
option2: Shared Cultures, Shared Heritage, Shared Responsibility
answer: Shared Cultures, Shared Heritage, Shared Responsibility
explanation:
April 18 is observed as World Heritage Day every year, to promote cultural heritage across the world. The celebrations are led by the International Council on Monuments and Sites (ICOMOS).
The proposal of the ICOMOS to celebrate April 18 as Heritage Day had been accepted by the UNESCO in 1983. The theme of this year’s observance is ‘Shared Cultures, Shared Heritage, Shared Responsibility’.
